definition: hot money, money flowing from one currency to another in the hope of quick profit
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: It's a paradox that Hot Money rushed in online game industry.
sentences.chinese: 熱錢湧入網遊行業，這是一個矛盾的話題。

sentences.english: Hot money is notoriously unstable and even more notoriously procyclical.
sentences.chinese: 熱錢素有不穩定的惡名，名聲更差的是其順週期性。

sentences.english: Hot money is flowing into the share market at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 毛楠說，“此刻，熱錢正在流入股市。

sentences.english: We will closely monitor and control cross-border capital flows and prevent the influx of hot money.
sentences.chinese: 密切監控跨境資本流動，防範“熱錢”流入。

sentences.english: Second, what is China's position on hot money?
sentences.chinese: 第二，中國對熱錢持何態度？

sentences.english: Then, the countries involved had built up debt loads that left them dependent on hot money.
sentences.chinese: 那麼，積債累累的相關國家必得依賴熱錢。

sentences.english: Hot money inflows will see major re-allocations due to the US ratings downgrade.
sentences.chinese: 美國主權信用評級的下調令部分國際熱錢轉移。

sentences.english: The two favoured destinations for now-skittish capital are Japan and America.
sentences.chinese: 熱錢現在最好的2個目標國家就是日本和美國。

sentences.english: When the financial crisis struck, this "hot money" quickly left the state.
sentences.chinese: 不過金融危機爆發後，高息存款這筆熱錢迅速抽逃。

sentences.english: And too sharp a rise in the yuan could send hot money coursing out of the country.
sentences.chinese: 而且人民幣過於急劇的升值可能讓熱錢奔出。

sentences.english: Part of the betting puzzle is to know where the big money is going on the game.
sentences.chinese: 博採組合的其中一環是要知道球賽的熱錢去了那裏。

sentences.english: Massive hot-money inflows present two dangers to China's economy.
sentences.chinese: 大規模的熱錢流入令中國經濟複線兩個危險。
一些熱錢已進入地產市場。
